revised_title: Influence of Altitude on Respiration: Experiments at Yvoire, Courmayeur, and Col de Géant
tldr: This article presents experiments conducted at Yvoire, Courmayeur, and the Col de Géant to study the effects of altitude on human respiration. The author investigates how altitude influences breathing rate, oxygen consumption, and carbon dioxide production in two individuals. The results provide insights into the physiological changes that occur at high altitudes and the challenges faced by mountain climbers.
